hero.des: Streamline your operations with our all-in-one platform—perfect for managing projects, data, and system health with simplicity and efficiency.

sponsors.title: Sponsors
sponsors.description: Dokploy is an open source project that is maintained by a community of volunteers. We would like to thank our sponsors for their support and contributions to the project, which help us to continue to develop and improve Dokploy.

primaryFeatures.title: Comprehensive Control for Your Digital Ecosystem
primaryFeatures.des: Simplify your project and data management, ensure robust monitoring, and secure your backups—all without the fuss over minute details.
primaryFeatures.projectsDes: Manage and organize all your projects in one place, keeping detailed track of progress and resource allocation.
primaryFeatures.applicationsDes: Centralize control over your applications and databases for enhanced security and efficiency, simplifying access and management across your infrastructure.
primaryFeatures.composeDes: Native Docker Compose support for manage complex applications and services with ease.
primaryFeatures.multinodeDes: Scale applications to multiples nodes using docker swarm to manage the cluster.
primaryFeatures.monitoringDes: Monitor your systems' performance and health in real time, ensuring continuous and uninterrupted operation.
primaryFeatures.backupsDes: Implement automatic and secure backup solutions to protect your critical data and restore it quickly when necessary.

secondaryFeatures.title: Advanced Management Tools
secondaryFeatures.des: Elevate your infrastructure with tools that offer precise control, detailed monitoring, and enhanced security, ensuring seamless management and robust performance.
secondaryFeatures.templatesSummary: One click to deploy open source templates.
secondaryFeatures.templatesDes: Deploy open source templates with one click, powered by Docker Compose, (Plausible, Calcom, Pocketbase, etc.)
secondaryFeatures.traefikSummary: Modify Traefik settings on-the-fly via a graphical interface or API.
secondaryFeatures.traefikDes: Users can adjust Traefik's configuration, including middleware, forwarding rules, and SSL certificates through an intuitive interface or API. This feature enables seamless traffic routing and security adjustments without the need to restart services
secondaryFeatures.usersSummary: Detailed control over user permissions for accessing and managing projects and services.
secondaryFeatures.usersDes: Allows administrators to define specific roles and permissions for each user, including the ability to create, modify, or delete applications and databases. This feature ensures secure and efficient management of large and diverse teams.
secondaryFeatures.terminalSummary: Direct access to each container's and server terminal for advanced management.
secondaryFeatures.terminalDes: Provides an interface to access the command line of any active container, allowing developers to execute commands, manage services, and troubleshoot directly from the dashboard

callToAction.title: Unlock Your Deployment Potential
callToAction.des: Streamline your deployments with our PaaS. Effortlessly manage Docker containers and traffic with Traefik. Boost your infrastructure's efficiency and security today

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.des: If you can't find what you're looking for, please submit an issue through our GitHub repository or ask questions on our Discord.
faq.a1: Dokploy is a stable, easy-to-use deployment solution designed to simplify the application management process. Think of Dokploy as a free alternative self-hostable solution to platforms like Heroku, Vercel, and Netlify.
faq.a2: Dokploy offers simplicity, flexibility, and speed in application deployment and management.
faq.a3: Yes, Dokploy is totally free. You can use it for personal projects, small teams, or even for large-scale applications.
faq.a4: Yes, Dokploy is open source and free to use.
faq.q5: What types of languages can I deploy with Dokploy?
faq.a5: Dokploy does not restrict programming languages. You are free to choose your preferred language and framework.
faq.q6: How do I request a feature or report a bug?
faq.a6: To request a feature or report a bug, please create an issue on our GitHub repository or ask in our Discord channel. We are currently focused on addressing existing bugs and plan to release new features soon.
faq.q7: Do you track the usage of Dokploy?
faq.a7: No, we don't track any usage data.
faq.q8: Are there any user forums or communities where I can interact with other users?
faq.a8: Yes, we have active GitHub discussions where you can share ideas, ask for help, and connect with other users.
faq.q9: What types of applications can I deploy with Dokploy?
faq.a9: Dokploy supports a variety of applications, including those built with Docker, as well as applications from any Git repository, offering custom builds with Nixpacks, Dockerfiles, or Buildpacks like Heroku and Paketo.
faq.q10: How does Dokploy handle database management?
faq.a10: Dokploy supports multiple database systems including Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, MongoDB, and Redis, providing tools for easy deployment and management directly from the dashboard.

Pricing.description: Deploy Smarter, Scale Faster – Without Breaking the Bank

section.title: Dokploy Open Source
section.description: Manager your own infrastructure installing dokploy ui in your own server.

features.f1: Complete Flexibility: Install Dokploy UI on your own infrastructure

section.title: Dokploy Plan
section.description: to manage Dokploy UI infrastructure, we take care of it for you.

features.f1: Managed Hosting: No need to manage your own servers

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.description: If you can’t find what you’re looking for, please send us an email to
faq.q1: How does Dokploy's Open Source plan work?
faq.a1: You can host Dokploy UI on your own infrastructure and you will be responsible for the maintenance and updates.
faq.q2: Do I need to provide my own server for the managed plan?
faq.a2: Yes, in the managed plan, you provide your own server eg(Hetzner, Hostinger, AWS, ETC.) VPS, and we manage the Dokploy UI infrastructure for you.
faq.q3: What happens if I need more than one server?
faq.a3: The first server costs $4.50/month, if you buy more than one it will be $3.50/month per server.
faq.q4: Is there a limit on the number of deployments?
faq.a4: No, there is no limit on the number of deployments in any of the plans.
faq.q5: What happens if I exceed my purchased server limit?
faq.a5: The most recently added servers will be deactivated. You won't be able to create services on inactive servers until they are reactivated.
faq.a6: We do not offer refunds. However, you can cancel your subscription at any time. Feel free to try our open-source version for free before making a purchase.
faq.q7: What kind of support do you offer?
faq.a7: We offer community support for the open source version and priority support for paid plans.
faq.a8: Yes, Dokploy is fully open-source. You can contribute or modify it as needed for your projects.
